case_title: Dr. AKHTAR BANO and others vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Chief Secretary and others
respondant: Government of Balochistan through Chief Secretary
complaint_summary: Appellants challenged their transfer orders issued via Notification No. SO-IV(H)4-6/2014/4235-350 dated 12-2-2015, claiming violation of the Wedlock Policy and Article 35 of the Constitution of Pakistan.
investigation_summary: The appellants argued that their transfers to distant districts violated the Wedlock Policy, which aims to facilitate postings of spouses at the same station, and caused undue hardship to their families.
judgment_summary: The court ruled that the impugned notification violated the Wedlock Policy and Articles 9 and 35 of the Constitution. It set aside the transfer orders to the extent of the appellants.
punishment: Impugned Notification dated 12-2-2015 set aside to the extent of appellants.
legal_arguments: Violation of Wedlock Policy as per Circular No. SORI-5(59)S&GAD5241-5341 dated 2-2-1998 and Circular No. SOR1-5(59)S&GAD2069-2170 dated 12-8-2006.
Violation of Article 35 of the Constitution of Pakistan, ensuring protection of family.
Violation of Article 9 of the Constitution, guaranteeing the right to life and security of persons.
statutes: Constitution of Islamic Republic of Pakistan
sections: Section 10 of Balochistan Civil Servants Act, 1974
key_issues: Discretionary powers under Section 10 of Balochistan Civil Servants Act, 1974
Constitutional protection of family under Article 35

maxims.Judicial Discretion: Discretion must be exercised judiciously and not arbitrarily.

legal_terms.Wedlock Policy: Policy facilitating postings of spouses at the same station.
legal_terms.Discretionary Powers: Authority to make decisions within legal bounds.

words_and_phrases.Life: Includes all rights necessary for a proper and comfortable existence.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves service appeals challenging transfer orders issued by the Government of Balochistan. The appellants argued that the transfers violated the Wedlock Policy and constitutional provisions protecting family and life. The court ruled in favor of the appellants, setting aside the impugned notification.
